answers.author: Yann Contratto
answers.text:
Dear Gregory,  
As Lord Kelvin used to say, "To measure is to know". Best practice will probably consists to measure Odor emission through Odor Flux Chamber (as given by USEPA), in order to measure odor emission flow (in odor unit per square inch of area and per second). From that result, depending distances with potential complainants, we could then determine percentage of remediation needed. In most cases, some real neutralizing agent can be used in order to decrease emissions, so also relative odor complaints.  
If you need any additional information, feel free to contact us at Info@OlfactoExpert.com   
We will also be present at the ICMA tradeshow in Boston this 22nd Sept.  
Best regards,  
Yann H. Contratto, Pr. Eng. - Odor & Air quality Expert  
CEO Olfacto Expert Inc.

author: Gregory Stopka
text: I have a member that is experiencing odor from its sanitary sewer system, especially when it is hot outside.  Any strategies on how to eliminate or limit odor that comes from the sewer?
title: Odor from Sanitary Sewer System
